title: Evaluation of suspected lung cancer
text: Lung cancer may present with chronic cough, hemoptysis, weight loss, and lymphadenopathy. Chest CT characterizes lesions; tissue diagnosis via bronchoscopic or excisional lymph node biopsy establishes histology. Staging guides therapy, including surgery, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and radiation depending on subtype and stage.

title: Approach to lymphadenopathy and suspected lymphoma
text: B symptoms (fever, night sweats, weight loss) with persistent lymphadenopathy raise concern for lymphoma. Elevated LDH may correlate with tumor burden. Excisional lymph node biopsy is preferred for definitive diagnosis and subclassification, which informs therapy with chemoimmunotherapy and targeted agents.

title: Acute myeloid leukemia: initial diagnosis
text: AML can present with fatigue, infections, and bleeding due to cytopenias. CBC with differential shows anemia and blasts; flow cytometry and cytogenetics define subtype. Prompt initiation of induction chemotherapy is standard after confirmation.
